abstract.description: This code for validation and benchmarking of the Mu and MuMonitor datasets is set up at Research level, i.e. it requires university-student-level programming experience. Minimal acquaintance with Linux and the ROOT analysis package (https://root.cern.ch/) as well as a basic text editor is needed. Note that the code in this category is not meant to be a pedagogical example but is a validation tool.

note.description: The default output of the code below is a ROOT file Mu00val.root

system_details.description: Use this code with the CMS Open Data VM environment

title: Validation code for 2010 Mu and MuMonitor datasets, based on dimuon mass spectrum

usage.description:
If you do not have the CERN Virtual Machine for 2010 CMS data installed, follow the instructions in step 1 at How to install a CERN Virtual Machine. Then install and run the Demo (demo analyzer) program following the instructions at How to Test & Validate.

To run the Mu and/or MuMonitor sample validation, follow the instructions in the file readme.txt above.

use_with.description: Use this with 2010 Mu and/or MuMonitor primary datasets (see detailed instructions in readme.txt and code).

validation.description: Only the list of validated runs are accepted:
